HelpXML.Title: FSMeda
HelpXML.Purpose: FSMeda performs forward search in multivariate analysis with exploratory data analysis purposes

Item.Name: Y
Item.LongDesc: n x v data matrix; n observations and v variables. Rows of Y represent observations, and columns represent variables. Missing values (NaN's) and infinite values (Inf's) are allowed, since observations (rows) with missing or infinite values will automatically be excluded from the computations.

Item.Name: bsb
Item.LongDesc: List of units forming the initial subset. If bsb=0 (default) then the procedure starts with v units randomly chosen else if bsb is not 0 the search will start with m0=length(bsb).

Item.Name: init
Item.ShortDesc: Point where to start monitoring required diagnostics.
Item.LongDesc: Note that if bsb is supplied, init>=length(bsb). If init is not specified it will be set equal to floor(n*0.6).

Item.Name: plots
Item.ShortDesc: It specify whether it is necessary to produce the plots of the monitoring of minMD.
Item.LongDesc: If plots=1, a plot of the monitoring of minMD among the units not belonging to the subset is produced on the screen with 1 per cent, 50 per cent and 99 per cent confidence bands else (default), all plots are suppressed.

Item.Name: msg
Item.ShortDesc: It controls whether to display or not messages about great interchange on the screen.
Item.LongDesc: If msg==1 (default) messages are displyed on the screen else no message is displayed on the screen.

Item.Name: scaled
Item.ShortDesc: It controls whether to monitor scaled Mahalanobis distances.
Item.LongDesc: If scaled=1 Mahalanobis distances monitored during the search are scaled using ratio of determinant. If scaled=2 Mahalanobis distances monitored during the search are scaled using asymptotic consistency factor. The default value is 0 that is Mahalanobis distances are not scaled.

Item.Name: nocheck
Item.ShortDesc: It controls whether to perform checks on matrix Y.
Item.LongDesc: If nocheck is equal to 1 no check is performed on matrix Y. As default nocheck=0.

ItemCell.Description: (n-init+1) x (v+1) matrix containing the monitoring of estimated of the means for each variable in each step of the forward search.
(n-init+1) x (2) matrix containing the monitoring of the determinant of the covariance matrix in each step of the forward search.

(n-init) x 11 Matrix which contains the unit(s) included in the subset at each step of the fwd search. REMARK: in every step the new subset is compared with the old subset. Un contains the unit(s) present in the new subset but not in the old one Un(1,2) for example contains the unit included in step init+1 Un(end,2) contains the units included in the final step of the search

References.Item: Atkinson Riani and Cerioli (2004), Exploring multivariate data with the forward search Springer Verlag, New York.
